summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on the Central African Republic (CAR), adopted resolution 2281 (2016) on 26 April 2016. The resolution extends the mandate of the United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the CAR (MINUSCA) until 31 July 2016. The Council authorizes MINUSCA to take all necessary means to carry out its mandate and extends the authorization provided by paragraph 50 of resolution 2217 (2015). A strategic review of MINUSCA will be conducted to adapt its mandate to the new circumstances in the CAR, with recommendations to be presented to the Security Council by 22 June 2016. The Council remains seized of the matter.
